title: Data Analyst
description:
Job Category: Information Technology

Time Type: Full time

Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Secret

Employee Type: Regular

Percentage of Travel Required: Up to 10%

Type of Travel: Continental US
• * *

The Opportunity

Are you ready to revolutionize financial auditability and transportation logistics? We're seeking talented Data Analysts to join our team in implementing a cutting-edge software system that will transform how businesses manage their finances and supply chains. From program management and cybersecurity to systems engineering and process optimization, we have exciting opportunities across multiple disciplines.*

If you're passionate about leveraging technology to streamline operations and enhance transparency, this is your chance to make a significant impact. Join us in building the future of financial and logistical management – your expertise could be the key to our success!
• Positions contingent upon contract award.

Responsibilities

Intermediate level -
• Examines data from various sources to provide insights into organization, mission/business processes, and information systems
• Design, document, and implement custom algorithms for data analysis and modeling
• Develops and optimizes workflow processes for efficient data handling and analysis
• Works with large data sets for modeling, data mining, and research purposes
• Creates and maintains databases and data systems
• Interprets data and analyzes results using statistical techniques
• Develops comprehensive reports and visual presentations to communicate findings
• Collaborates with cross-functional teams to identify and solve business problems
• Stays current with emerging technologies and methodologies in data science and analytics

Senior level -
• Examines data from various sources to provide insights into organization, mission/business processes, and information systems
• Design, document, and implement custom algorithms for data modeling, mining, and research purposes
• Develops and optimizes workflow processes to enhance data analysis efficiency and effectiveness
• Works with large data sets to extract valuable insights and support decision-making processes
• Creates and maintains comprehensive documentation for data analysis processes and findings
• Collaborates with cross-functional teams to identify data needs and deliver actionable insights
• Develops and implements data quality assurance processes
• Presents complex data findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
• Stays current with emerging trends and technologies in data analysis and machine learning
• Mentors junior team members and contributes to the overall data strategy of the organization

Subject Matter Expert/SME level -
• Examines data from various sources to provide deep insights into organization, mission/business processes, and information systems
• Design, document, and implement custom algorithms for complex data analysis and predictive modeling
• Develops and optimizes workflow processes for efficient data handling and analysis
• Creates and manages large data sets for modeling, data mining, and research purposes
• Leads advanced analytics projects, from conception to implementation and evaluation
• Provides expert guidance on data strategy, architecture, and best practices
• Collaborates with cross-functional teams to integrate data-driven insights into business operations
• Mentors junior analysts and contribute to the overall data culture of the organization
• Stays at the forefront of emerging trends and technologies in data science and analytics
• Presents complex findings to executive leadership and stakeholders in a clear, actionable manner

Qualifications

Required:

Intermediate -
• Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field (equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered in lieu of degree)
• 3-8 years of experience in data analysis or a related field
• US Citizen with Secret security clearance, or ability to obtain/maintain Secret clearance upon hire
• Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL
• Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
• Solid understanding of statistical analysis and machine learning techniques
• Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark)
• Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills
• Strong communication skills with the ability to present complex data in an understandable format
• Experience working with large and complex data sets

Senior -
• Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field (equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered in lieu of degree)
• 8-11 years of experience in data analysis, with a focus on algorithm design and implementation
• US Citizen with Secret security clearance, or ability to obtain/maintain Secret clearance upon hire
• Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL
• Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
• In-depth knowledge of statistical analysis and machine learning techniques
• Proven track record of working with large, complex datasets
• Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
• Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences
• Experience in documenting and implementing data analysis workflows

SME -
• Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered in lieu of degree)
• Minimum of 12 years of progressive experience in data analysis and analytics
• US Citizen with Secret security clearance, or ability to obtain/maintain Secret clearance upon hire
• Proven track record of designing and implementing custom algorithms and data models
• Expert-level proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL
• Extensive experience with big data technologies and cloud-based analytics platforms
• Strong understanding of machine learning techniques and their practical applications
• Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to translate complex data into actionable insights
• Superior communication skills, both written and verbal
• Experience in government contracting or defense industry analytics preferred
• Ability to obtain and maintain required security clearances

Desired

Intermediate -
• Master's degree in a relevant field
• Professional certifications in data analysis or related areas
• Experience in government contracting or defense industry data analysis
• Knowledge of cybersecurity principles and practices
• Familiarity with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure)

Senior -
• Master's degree in a relevant field
• Experience with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
• Knowledge of big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark)
• Familiarity with government or defense sector data analysis
• Relevant certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Data Analytics, Google Data Analytics Professional Certificate)

SME -
• Ph.D. in a relevant field
• Relevant certifications (e.g., Certified Analytics Professional, AWS Certified Data Analytics)
• Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
• Publication record or speaking engagements in data science or related fields
• Expertise in specific domains relevant to CACI's work (e.g., cybersecurity, intelligence analysis)

This position is contingent on funding and may not be filled immediately. However, this position is representative of positions within CACI that are consistently available. Individuals who apply may also be considered for other positions at CACI.

________________________________________________________________________________________

What You Can Expect

A culture of integrity.

At CACI, we place character and innovation at the center of everything we do. As a valued team member, you’ll be part of a high-performing group dedicated to our customer’s missions and driven by a higher purpose – to ensure the safety of our nation.

An environment of trust.

CACI values the unique contributions that every employee brings to our company and our customers - every day. You’ll have the autonomy to take the time you need through a unique flexible time off benefit and have access to robust learning resources to make your ambitions a reality.

A focus on continuous growth.

Together, we will advance our nation's most critical missions, build on our lengthy track record of business success, and find opportunities to break new ground — in your career and in our legacy.

Your potential is limitless. So is ours.

Learn more about CACI here.

________________________________________________________________________________________

Pay Range: There are a host of factors that can influence final salary including, but not limited to, geographic location, Federal Government contract labor categories and contract wage rates, relevant prior work experience, specific skills and competencies, education, and certifications. Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives. We offer competitive compensation, benefits and learning and development opportunities. Our broad and competitive mix of benefits options is designed to support and protect employees and their families. At CACI, you will receive comprehensive benefits such as; healthcare, wellness, financial, retirement, family support, continuing education, and time off benefits. Learn more here.

Since this position can be worked in more than one location, the range shown is the national average for the position.

The Proposed Salary Range For This Position Is

$82,100-$172,400

CACI is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.

title: Data Analyst - Assurance - Analytics Delivery - Senior Manager - Multiple Positions - 1600237
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.

EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities.

Data Analyst, Assurance, Analytics Delivery (Senior Manager) (Multiple Positions) (1600237), Ernst & Young U.S. LLP, Denver, Colorado.

Drive operational improvements and efficiency around the audit process. Collaborate with Assurance teams to deliver in-depth data analysis as part of the audit service provided to clients. Request, capture, transfer, transform and prepare client data for analysis for integrating analytics into the audit. Coordinate the development of industry-specific or custom analytical tools for audit teams. Analyze complex data utilizing a suite of analytical tools. Deliver range of analytics results in written and presentation formats. Create work papers that document the engagement procedures performed in a concise and organized manner. Stay informed of analytics solutions, auditing and accounting standards that affect business processes analyzed.

Lead and direct teams of professionals with diverse skills and backgrounds by providing constructive on-the-job feedback/coaching to team members. Develop and maintain long-term client relationships and networks. Manage risk in the delivery of quality client services. Generate and manage new business opportunities.

Full time employment, Monday – Friday, 40 hours per week, 8:30 am – 5:30 pm.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

Must have a Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Information Systems, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics or related field and 8 years of related work experience (of which 5 years must be progressive, post-baccalaureate work experience). Alternatively, will accept a Master’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Information Systems, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics or related field and 7 years of related work experience.

Must have 5 years of experience with data analysis including data capture and data transformation; ETL tools including Alteryx and visualization tools including Power BI.

Must have year 4 years of experience with analytical tools in one or a combination involving the following: Python, PySpark, Apache Spark, DAX Studio, Tabular Editor, JavaScript, and/or

D3.js.

Must have 4 years of experience with developing data visualization dashboards for communication of anomalies, patterns and trends, using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Spotfire

using structured and unstructured data sources.

Must have 4 years of experience with financial business processes including experience working with audit teams and audit clients.

Must have 4 years of project management experience including multiple projects and deadlines.

Must have 4 years of experience with audit of data analytics.

Must have 4 years of experience with writing and presenting findings to various stakeholders.

Must have 4 years of experience using database management software, statistical and predictive machine learning software, robotic process automation and AI.

Must have 4 years of experience in cloud computing in one or a combination involving the following: Rack Space, Citrix, Microsoft Azure platform and/or Microsoft Azure Databricks.

Must have 4 years of experience with ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) specific tools such as SAP or Oracle, and ERP data models.

Requires domestic travel up to 20% in order to serve client needs.

Employer will accept any suitable combination of education, training, or experience.

Please apply on-line at ey.com/en_us/careers and click on "Careers - Job Search”, then “Search Jobs" (Job Number - 1600237)

Applications will be accepted until 6/20/2025.

What we offer

We offer a comprehensive compensation and beneﬁts package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The base salary for this job is $196,720.00 per year. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Join us in our team-led and leader-enabled hybrid model. Our expectation is for most people in external, client serving roles to work together in person 40-60% of the time over the course of an engagement, project or year. Under our ﬂexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, ﬁnancial, and emotional well-being.
• Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
• Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
• Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
• Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

EY accepts applications for this position on an on-going basis. If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

For those living in California, please click here for additional information.

EY provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, in accordance with applicable law. 

EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities, including veterans with disabilities. If you have a disability and either need assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during any part of the application process, please call 1-800-EY-HELP3, type Option 2 (HR-related inquiries) and then type Option 1 (HR Shared Services Center), which will route you to EY’s Talent Shared Services Team or email SSC Customer Support at ssc.customersupport@ey.com.

This particular position at Ernst & Young in the United States requires the qualified candidate to be a "United States worker" as defined by the U.S. Department of Labor regulations at 20 CFR 656.3. You can review this definition at https://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/pkg/CFR-2011-title20-vol3/pdf/CFR-2011-title20-vol3-sec656-3.pdf at the bottom of page 750. Please feel free to apply to other positions that do not require you to be a "U.S. worker".

title: Data Analyst (Remote)
description:
Data Analyst - Remote

A large financial institution in the Denver Metro area is looking for a Data Analyst to join their team for a 12 month contract with the ultimate goal of bringing this candidate on full time at the end of the contract. This person will be collecting data from different stake holders within the CPMO and trying to identify themes and process improvement on projects over 2 million dollars. As part of the Operations team, this role responds to internal customer inquiries, matures and improves CPMO and project management practices, and supports the processes required to operate the CPMO effectively including tool administration, data management, and reporting functions. This role has an emphasis on creating and maintenance of enterprise data assets while actively support reporting, data analytics to inform decision making, creating technical requirements to design data capabilities, and has a vision to see the possibilities.

The successful candidate will be a core part of the CPMO team which requires strong project management, communication, customer services, stakeholder management, and team building skills. Familiarity with agile software development practices is a plus.

Act as a first point of contact for inquiries and support requests for the CPMO, addressing questions, and meeting established SLAs while being an advocate for the development and use of project management best practices in an agile environment.

title: DBA / Data Analyst
description:
Description:
• *Onsite | Greenwood Village, CO**

Our client, an industry leader in telecommunications, has an excellent opportunity for a DBA / Data Analyst to work on contract-to-hire opportunity. The DBA / Data Analyst will join a team focused on providing custom solutions leveraging Speech Analytics and AI technology to Customer Operations, Inbound Sales & Retention, Digital Self Service, Business Planning, and Exec level verticals based on customer interactions with our Agents.

Due to client requirement, applicants must be willing and able to work on a w2 basis. For our w2 consultants, we offer a great benefits package that includes Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits, 401k with company matching, and life insurance.

Rate: $35 - $41 / hr. w2

Responsibilities:
• Creates and maintains databases for test, development and production environments. Analyzes, tests, and implements physical database design.
• Documents environment and maintain current patches.
• Ensures data recovery, maintenance, data integrity, and space requirements for physical databases are met through formulation and monitoring of policies, procedures, and standards relating to database management.
• Audits the current environments, provides capacity planning and best practices for the future production/development/test environments, which may include establishing new standards and procedures.
• Conducts performance assessment and tuning as related to the database system.
• Provides technical knowledge working with system administrators, technical managers, developers, and architects.

Task Breakdown %:
• Data Pipeline Development and Maintenance (30-40%)
• Building and maintaining ETL process from various sources into company data environment like snowflake, azure, fabric. Also involves building views and monitoring pipelines to ensure they run smoothly.
• Data Modeling and Prototyping (20-25%)
• Designing and prototyping new data structures and exploring how to leverage new tools or platforms (like azure and fabric). This includes creating proof-of-concept models and ensuring data is organized for easy access and analysis.
• Collaboration and Requirements (15-20%)
• Working with other teams to understand data needs, defining requirements, and creating data views that can be shared across the organization.
• Data Integration and Governance (10-15%)
• Ensuring proper data governance, security, and access control. This also includes integrating data from various sources to create a unified and comprehensive dataset.
• Testing and Quality Assurance (10%)
• Regularly testing data pipelines, validating data accuracy, and ensuring the integrity of the data structures.

Experience Requirements:
• Experience with Data manipulation and statistical modeling as a Scientist, Consultant, Architect, DBA, or Engineer
• Expertise in SQL.
• Experience with big data warehouse cloud platforms (e.g., Redshift, Snowflake, Fabric).
• Familiarity with ETL pipeline orchestration (e.g., Apache, Fabric data flows).
• Distributed computing tools such as Hadoop or Map/Reduce
• Using data science toolkits such as Python or R
• Familiarity with the properties of the major families of machine learning techniques

Education Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent
• Some experience with Spark and Python is a plus.

title: Data Analyst (part-time)
description:
ACC’s Institutional Research team is seeking a motivated and detail-oriented part-time Data Analyst to support data collection, analysis, and reporting initiatives that inform institutional planning and policy. This is a great opportunity for recent graduates or early-career professionals interested in data analytics, research, and the impact of higher education.

This is a short-term, temporary position through the end of June 2025. It’s anticipated that this position will work an average of 10 hours per week.

Under the supervision of Institutional Research (IR) staff and following documented procedures, the entry-level data analyst will assist with specific, basic data analysis and standardization tasks to support reporting and deliverables. Responsibilities include contributing to discrete data projects under the guidance of IR analysts and the director, performing data draws and compiling data files, conducting data entry, manipulation, and validation, and transferring data to reporting dashboards for recurring reports. The role also involves documenting processes, preparing summary data for website updates, and interpreting and standardizing data from multiple sources.
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to compile, organize, standardize, analyze, and interpret large sets of data.
• Advanced proficiency with data transformation and analysis in Excel or similar spreadsheet application (e.g., Google Sheets).
• Basic knowledge of statistical concepts and techniques.
• Knowledge of college and university data and/or related subject matter (e.g., students, enrollment topics, student success) is ideal, but possible related skillsets may be found from engineering, math and computer science, among other disciplines.
• Bachelor's degree or an equivalent combination of education and/or relevant experience.
Please submit a resume and cover letter detailing your experience and qualifications for this role.This is a short-term, temporary position through the end of June 2025. It’s anticipated that this position will work an average of 10 hours per week.

title: Marketing Data Analyst - Part Time
description:
Overview

Lifeway is seeking a Part-Time Marketing Analyst to support digital campaign performance across Lifeway-owned platforms. In this role, you will leverage tools like Adobe Analytics and GA4 to ensure accurate tracking and reporting of marketing campaigns—including ads, emails, and other key initiatives. Your work will enable data-informed decision-making and improve the impact of Lifeway’s digital strategies. This position requires deep expertise in web analytics and a passion for transforming data into actionable insights.

Why Lifeway?

This is a place where you can bring your faith and work experience to join in the most important mission in the world: making disciples of Jesus Christ. Whether you’re a creator or storyteller, data guru or problem-solver, or anywhere in between, if you’re passionate about serving the church, we have a place for you. Lifeway has a strong Work from Anywhere (WFA) culture that is deeply focused on our mission and values. While headquartered in Nashville, TN, many of our positions are remote-eligible and have autonomy and flexibility with work hours. We provide equipment and resources to ensure team members have access to a productive and ergonomic workspace. Lifeway hosts all-team meetings several times per year and provides travel for key team gatherings for remote-based team members. Full-time employees are eligible for enrollment in our comprehensive benefits plans including healthcare, vacation and sick time, holiday pay, care days, 401(k) plan, maternity and paternity leave, adoption assistance, mission trip time, and more.

Learn more about our culture at team.lifeway.com/culture-code

This is a remote position in the U.S with occasional travel to Nashville for in-person team gatherings. #LI-Remote

Responsibilities
• Lives out Lifeway’s mission and values, showing deep commitment to Kingdom work
• Maintain digital analytics solutions involving Adobe Analytics and GA4 across Lifeway web properties, including tracking codes and tracking code generation tools are current. Create reports and dashboards as needed and ensure proper tracking is in place for reporting.
• Work in collaboration with business leads from marketing to ensure that business requirements are being met and that campaign data is captured and is clean. Collaborate with vendor(s) for digital programs, projects, and Adobe Analytics data extraction and migration activities
• Develop and maintain documentation regarding governance for analytics solutions and tag management
• Enable integration of data from business partner platforms and back-end systems with analytics to provide a holistic view of digital operations and marketing efforts

Qualifications

Education

High School Diploma required

Bachelor's degree preferred

Masters degree not required

Advanced graduate degree (PhD, etc.) not required

Skills, Knowledge, & Experiences, required
• 3+ years of experience working with a Sales and/or Marketing Operations team
• 3+ years of experience using GA4, Adobe Analytics, or similar tools
• 3+ years of experience in reporting and data analysis with strong analytical skills and mastery of Microsoft Excel and Power BI
• 2+ years of experience in data storytelling using Tableau, Power BI, or similar BI tools
• Proven expertise in campaign tracking
• Strong written and verbal communication skills
• Project management experience in a matrixed environment
• Experience with data mining techniques
• Demonstrated ability to work independently and lead initiatives
• Familiarity with Salesforce products, including Marketing Cloud and reporting tools
• 20 hours per week scheduled.

Actively involved in an evangelical Christian church

Skills, Knowledge, & Experiences, preferred
• Ability to travel, occasionally overnight
• Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

title: Healthcare Operation Data Analyst (Part-time/Remote)
description:
Healthcare Operation Data Analyst (Part-Time)

Integral Health - Remote or Hybrid in NYC

About Integral Health

Integral Health is redefining the landscape of behavioral health through innovative, technology-driven solutions designed to integrate seamlessly into primary care. Our vision is to make behavioral healthcare reach everyone in need. We believe in amplifying human connections to improve the health outcomes of patients and their communities. By leveraging the power of technology and evidence-based models like Collaborative Care, we aim to make mental health services more accessible, efficient, and effective for everyone.

Position Overview

As a Data Analyst at Integral Health, you will play a vital role in transforming our operational data into actionable insights that drive business decisions and improve patient outcomes. Working part-time, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to build and maintain operational dashboards, conduct data analysis, and support our mission of revolutionizing behavioral healthcare through data-driven strategies.

Core Responsibilities
• Design, develop, and maintain operational data flows and dashboards in Databricks environment to track key performance indicators and business metrics
• Clean, manipulate, and analyze complex datasets using Python and SQL to support business decision-making
• Generate regular reports on operational metrics such as patient retention, lifetime value (LTV), engagement rates, and other healthcare-specific KPIs
• Collaborate with clinical and business teams to identify data needs and translate them into analytical solutions
• Develop and implement data quality processes to ensure accuracy and reliability of reporting
• Identify trends and patterns in operational data to provide recommendations for process improvements
• Support ad-hoc analysis requests from leadership and stakeholders

Key Requirements
• 3+ years of experience in data analysis or business intelligence roles, preferably in healthcare or SaaS environments
• Proficiency in Python for data manipulation, cleaning, and analysis
• Experience building and maintaining dashboards in Databricks or similar environments
• Strong SQL skills for querying and analyzing large datasets
• Experience working with operational metrics such as retention, LTV, conversion rates, and engagement metrics
• Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or related field

Preferred Qualifications
• Experience in healthcare or behavioral health startups
• Familiarity with healthcare data structures and metrics
• Knowledge of data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, or similar)
• Understanding of statistical analysis and modeling techniques
• Experience with version control systems (Git)
• Ability to communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders

About You
• You are detail-oriented with a passion for turning data into actionable insights
• You thrive in fast-paced startup environments and can adapt to changing priorities
• You have excellent communication skills and can translate technical concepts for non-technical audiences
• You are self-motivated and can work independently with minimal supervision
• You have a genuine interest in healthcare innovation and improving mental health outcomes

This Isn't for You If
• You prefer rigid, unchanging work environments with clearly defined processes
• You're uncomfortable with the ambiguity and rapid iteration common in startup environments
• You prefer working exclusively with clean, perfectly structured datasets
• You're looking for a full-time position with traditional hours

Location & Hours

This is a part-time position (15-25 hours per week) with flexible work arrangements:
• Fully remote option available
• Hybrid option available for candidates based in the NYC metro area
• Potential for conversion to full-time employment based on performance and business needs

• Full Professional Proficiency in English language

Equal Opportunity

At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

If you are an SEO with strong Excel and data analysis chops, you'd be a great fit as well.

• Technical SEO analysis & strategy
• General SEO analysis and strategy

title: Data Analyst II
description: As a community, the University of Rochester is defined by a deep commitment to Meliora - Ever Better. Embedded in that ideal are the values we share: equity, leadership, integrity, openness, respect, and accountability. Together, we will set the highest standards for how we treat each other to ensure our community is welcoming to all and is a place where all can thrive. Job Location (Full Address): 601 Elmwood Ave, Rochester, New York, United States of America, 14642 Opening: Worker Subtype: Regular Time Type: Part time Scheduled Weekly Hours: 34 Department: 400079 Pediatrics M&D Admin Work Shift: UR - Day (United States of America) Range: UR URG 108 H Compensation Range: $24.91 - $34.87 The referenced pay range represents the minimum and maximum compensation for this job. Individual annual salaries/hourly rates will be set within the job's compensation range, and will be determined by considering factors including, but not limited to, market data, education, experience, qualifications, expertise of the individual, and internal equity considerations. Responsibilities: GENERAL PURPOSE: With limited supervision, and latitude for and exercising independent judgment, creativity, and decision making, provides data analytics, business and project management support to the Golisano Children’s Hospital (GCH) Chief Administrative Officer and Chief Nursing Officer (40% of effort) and the GCH Quality and Safety Team (60% of effort). Develops methods for data collection, analysis, and reporting for assigned area. Utilizes best practices. Analyzes and interprets data using statistical techniques. Identifies actionable insights and recommendations. Creates presentations and reports based on findings. Works directly with clients to identify analytical requirements as well as collect data requirements, analyze, determine technical issues, and design ad-hoc reports, dashboards, and other visualizations. Collects, analyzes and documents business requirements and translates into function and system requirement specifications. May guide other less experienced team members and assist in coordinating project teams. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS Data Collection & Management Performed in support of Chief Administrative Officer, Chief Nursing Officer, and the Quality and Safety Team: Partners with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data requirements. Gathers, cleans, and organizes data from internal and external sources, including hospital (e.g., Epic, McKesson) systems and external datasets. Ensures data integrity, accuracy, and completeness for use in analysis and reporting. Maintains data repositories, ensuring accessibility and efficiency for future reporting needs. Collaborates with ISD and data engineering teams to streamline data pipelines and optimize storage systems. Works with teams to identify and resolve data-related issues and inefficiencies; suggests and implements strategies for improving data collection processes and for ensuring data accuracy and consistency. Data Analysis & Reporting Performed in support of Chief Administrative Officer, Chief Nursing Officer, and the Quality and Safety Team: Analyzes data using statistical and analytical tools to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Develops dashboards, visualizations, and reports to present data findings to various stakeholders. Performs ad-hoc analyses as needed to support organizational goals. Provides actionable recommendations based on data insights to improve business performance. Communicates analysis results, methodologies, and implications effectively to non-technical stakeholders. Provides training or support to colleagues on the use of data tools and systems. Project Management Performed in support of the Quality and Safety Team: Plans, coordinates, and executes projects related to performance analysis and quality improvement. Develops detailed project plans, sets timelines, and defines deliverables to ensure timely completion of initiatives. Monitors project progress, identifies risks, and recommends solutions to address delays or roadblocks. Facilitates communication and coordination among cross-functional teams involved in projects. Documents project outcomes, lessons learned, and recommendations for process improvements. Survey Submission and Analysis Performed in support of Chief Clinical Officer, Chief Nursing Officer, and the Quality and Safety Team: Leads the preparation, completion, and submission of the annual U.S. News & World Report Best Hospitals survey Collaborates with clinical, operational, and administrative teams to collect and validate data required for surveys. Analyzes survey methodologies to ensure accurate representation of the organization’s achievements and strengths. Develops and documents processes to streamline the preparation and submission of future surveys. Monitors and tracks changes in survey guidelines and reporting requirements to ensure compliance. Analyzes survey results, benchmarking the organization’s performance against peers. Identifies strengths, gaps, and opportunities based on survey outcomes and performance metrics. Conducts root-cause analyses to understand underperformance in specific areas. Collaborates with hospital leadership and quality improvement teams to develop actionable strategies for improving rankings in future surveys. Tracks progress on implemented strategies and adjust recommendations as needed based on new data or emerging trends. Other duties as assigned QUALFICATIONS Required: Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Health Informatics, Business Analytics, or a related field. 3–5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within healthcare or hospital administration. Strong understanding of healthcare data, including quality metrics, patient satisfaction scores, and operational benchmarks. Exceptional problem-solving skills, attention to detail and accuracy. Advanced proficiency in Excel and other data manipulation tools. Strong communication and presentation skills. Preferred: Experience with electronic medical record (EMR) systems and data extraction tools (e.g., Epic, Epic Clarity). Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI. Proficiency with SQL, Python, R, or other data analysis languages. The University of Rochester is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving an inclusive and welcoming culture to advance the University’s Mission to Learn, Discover, Heal, Create – and Make the World Ever Better. In support of our values and those of our society, the University is committed to not discriminating on the basis of age, color, disability, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, military/veteran status, national origin, race, religion/creed, sex, sexual orientation, citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law (Protected Classes). This commitment extends to non-discrimination in the administration of our policies, admissions, employment, access, and recruitment of candidates for all persons consistent with our values and based on applicable law. Notice: If you are a Current Employee, please log into myURHR to search for and apply to jobs using the Jobs Hub. Your application, if submitted using this portal, cannot be moved forward. Learn. Discover. Heal. Create. Located in western New York, Rochester is our namesake and our home. One of the world’s leading research universities, Rochester has a long tradition of breaking boundaries—always pushing and questioning, learning and unlearning. We transform ideas into enterprises that create value and make the world ever better. If you’re looking for a career in higher education or health care, the University of Rochester may offer the perfect opportunity for your background and goals At the University of Rochester, we commit to diversity, equity, and inclusion and united by a strong commitment to be ever better—Meliora. It is an ideal that informs our shared mission to ensure all members of our community feel safe, respected, included, and valued.

description:
Part-time / Remote | The Hold Label

We’re looking for an experienced and data-driven Performance Marketing Analyst to support our ongoing growth across paid and owned channels. This is a freelance/contract role with flexible hours, ideal for someone who can work independently while collaborating closely with our founder and broader creative team.

title: Data Analyst, Mid
description:
Data Analyst, Mid

The Opportunity:

As an analytics professional, you love diving into data and turning it into meaningful insights. Do you want to use your analytical mindset and grow your technical skills while developing solutions to problems? Are you excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set? In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open new opportunities. As a data analyst at Booz Allen, you can help turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors, we need you to help find the answers in the data.

On our team, you'll use your communication skills and analytical expertise to create real-world impact. You will be working with a multi-disciplinary team of data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, electrical engineers, test engineers, developers, and data consumers in a fast-paced, agile environment directly assisting Department of Defense clients, such as the U.S. Air Force, in the testing and certification of new or modified aircraft systems. You'll work closely with clients to understand the requirements behind every effort, and then dig into their data and documentation to help find the pieces of their information puzzle. You'll run analytical tools, clean and transform data, conduct research, draft, review, and edit analytical reports, and effectively communicate results to the client in support of their decisions. You'll guide teammates and help lead analytical processes and the development of algorithms and systems. You'll use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn sets of disparate data points into objective answers to advise your clients as they make informed decisions. Ultimately, you'll provide a deep understanding of the data, what it all means, and how it can be used.

Work with us as we use data for good.

What You'll Work On:
• Use your technical knowledge and analytical mindset to support client and stakeholder relationships.
• Research, develop, and test data methodologies, and generate cross-functional solutions through collection, interpretation, design of experiments, evaluation, and analysis of large data sets.
• Apply your skills and data analytics experience by simplifying technical requirements and trends, based on audience.
• Present data findings and recommendations to clients and stakeholders using your knowledge of databases, scripting languages such as SQL, R, and Python, and Microsoft Office Suite.
• Establish quantitative and qualitative metrics and key performance indicators to drive technical outcomes.
• Apply data visualization through different formats such as graphs, tables, PowerPoint presentations, and Tableau Dashboards.
• Grow your communication and technical skills by merging big data to create data-centric solutions across the testing and evaluation industry.

Join us. The world can't wait.

You Have:
• 2+ years of experience with data exploration, data cleaning, data analysis, data visualization, or data mining
• 2+ years of experience communicating analysis in both written and verbal form
• Experience writing analytical and technical reports and developing data visualizations to deliver key insights
• Experience with a scripting language such as SQL, R, or Python to extract data and perform analytics and visualizations
• Experience communicating and presenting analyses
• Knowledge of good data principles, including data cleaning, preprocessing, and wrangling
• Ability to clearly convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders and provide writing samples
• Ability to maintain accuracy while dealing with large data sets with a high attention to detail and quality
• Secret clearance
• Bachelor's degree

Nice If You Have:
• Experience with inferential statistics, including hypothesis testing, confidence intervals, and design of experiments
• Experience with DevOps principles and Agile methodologies such as Kanban and Scrum
• Experience with version control systems such as Git
• Experience with electrical engineering data such as sensor data, signal processing, and system logs
• Experience with the 1553 bus system
• Experience in Developmental or Operational Test and Evaluation
• Knowledge of descriptive statistics, including measures of central tendency and dispersion
• Knowledge of probability distributions, both discrete and continuous
• Top Secret clearance

Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Secret clearance is required.

Compensation

At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen's benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.

Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual's particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $61,900.00 to $141,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen's total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.

Identity Statement

As part of the application process, you are expected to be on camera during interviews and assessments. We reserve the right to take your picture to verify your identity and prevent fraud.

Work Model
Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.
• If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you'll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
• If this position is listed as onsite, you'll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.

Commitment to Non-Discrimination

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

job_highlights.title: Qualifications

items: At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being
Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care

Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual's particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements
The projected compensation range for this position is $61,900.00 to $141,000.00 (annualized USD)

job_highlights.title: Responsibilities
items: As an analytics professional, you love diving into data and turning it into meaningful insights
On our team, you'll use your communication skills and analytical expertise to create real-world impact

You will be working with a multi-disciplinary team of data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, electrical engineers, test engineers, developers, and data consumers in a fast-paced, agile environment directly assisting Department of Defense clients, such as the U.S. Air Force, in the testing and certification of new or modified aircraft systems
You'll work closely with clients to understand the requirements behind every effort, and then dig into their data and documentation to help find the pieces of their information puzzle
You'll run analytical tools, clean and transform data, conduct research, draft, review, and edit analytical reports, and effectively communicate results to the client in support of their decisions
You'll guide teammates and help lead analytical processes and the development of algorithms and systems
You'll use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn sets of disparate data points into objective answers to advise your clients as they make informed decisions
Ultimately, you'll provide a deep understanding of the data, what it all means, and how it can be used
Use your technical knowledge and analytical mindset to support client and stakeholder relationships
Research, develop, and test data methodologies, and generate cross-functional solutions through collection, interpretation, design of experiments, evaluation, and analysis of large data sets
Apply your skills and data analytics experience by simplifying technical requirements and trends, based on audience
Present data findings and recommendations to clients and stakeholders using your knowledge of databases, scripting languages such as SQL, R, and Python, and Microsoft Office Suite
Establish quantitative and qualitative metrics and key performance indicators to drive technical outcomes
Apply data visualization through different formats such as graphs, tables, PowerPoint presentations, and Tableau Dashboards
Grow your communication and technical skills by merging big data to create data-centric solutions across the testing and evaluation industry
If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you'll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility
If this position is listed as onsite, you'll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role

title: Healthcare Data Analyst – Placement Strategy & GIS (Long-Term)
description:
Description:

We’re a healthcare company supporting mental health practitioners in California. We’re building a data-driven strategy to place evaluators in areas of highest demand using geospatial analysis, ZIP code data, and internal metrics.

We have a clear analytic strategy in place and now need a skilled, ongoing data analyst to:

Maintain and update datasets

Execute our geospatial logic

Deliver structured reports twice a year

Organize outputs in a well-structured repository

(Eventually) help us build simple dashboards to support long-term decisions

This is a long-term, part-time engagement with periodic deep dives (2x/year) and light maintenance in between.

✅ Responsibilities include:

Clean and normalize evaluator rosters and panel demand data

Fuzzy match new evaluator lists to master datasets

Perform ZIP-based geospatial analysis (30-mile radius logic, evaluator demand mapping)

Identify underserved regions using evaluator-to-demand ratios

Build and maintain a structured data repository (Google Drive or Dropbox)

Deliver cleaned datasets, matched outputs, and clear documentation

(Eventually) help build and maintain lightweight dashboards for coverage, performance, and internal ops

📂 Data Repository Maintenance:

Organize raw, cleaned, and output files with clear folder structure and naming conventions

Maintain metadata on data sources, update dates, and assumptions used

Prepare a README file or index to help others navigate the system easily

📊 Future Dashboards (Optional / Phase 2+):

Geospatial evaluator coverage (map with demand overlay)

Evaluator productivity tracker

Demand update summary (twice-yearly review)

Dataset version control and change log

🎯 Required Skills:

Strong Excel / Google Sheets (pivot tables, VLOOKUP/XLOOKUP, filters, cleaning)

Experience with ZIP code matching, radius logic, and geospatial calculations

Fuzzy name matching and basic data reconciliation

Familiarity with geospatial tools (Google Maps API, QGIS, Mapbox, or similar)

Organized, thoughtful, and able to document assumptions clearly

Optional but preferred: Python (pandas, fuzzywuzzy, geopy) or R

🌎 Bonus Qualifications:

Experience with U.S. healthcare, legal, or regulatory data

Experience maintaining dashboards in Looker Studio, Tableau, or Power BI

Experience scraping or comparing evolving regulatory databases

💼 Project Scope:

Start with a small test project (5–10 hours)

Ongoing support for twice-yearly updates + ad hoc questions and analyses

Rate: $15–30/hour depending on experience

Open to international applicants

🧩 To apply, please include:

A brief summary of your experience with data cleaning and geospatial analysis

Any examples of past dashboard or ZIP code-based work

Your availability and interest in part-time, long-term support

title: Data Analyst
description:
The final salary or hourly wage, as applicable, paid to each candidate/applicant for this position is ultimately dependent on a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, the candidate’s/applicant’s qualifications, skills, and level of experience as well as the geographical location of the position.

Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Sponsorship not available.

Our client is seeking a Data Analyst in Denver, CO.

Role Description

• Support Wi-Fi Engineering releases for Router Firmware, Plume Open Sync Cloud, and router feature releases with detailed readouts of success metrics
• Develop complex data marts to enhance and track understanding of customer behaviour
• Design Tableau visualizations to communicate and distill data to leadership
• Enhance data automation within the CI Analysis Wi-Fi team for data pipelines by collaborating with ETL partners
• Create business requirements for reports.
• Code reports and share screens for review.
• Ensure no outliers are left out in data analysis.

Skills & Requirements

• Analytics Knowledge:
• Beneficial if acquired through school or business experience.
• Data Visualization:
• Use Tableau for data visualization (60-70% of the job).
• Good to have skills in Python, Bash, or C++.
• CS Degree preferred but not required.
• SQL experience Required
• Perform queries and write jobs.
• Screen candidates rigorously for SQL skills during all interviews.

Benefits/Other Compensation

This position is a contract/temporary role where Hays offers you the opportunity to enroll in full medical benefits, dental benefits, vision benefits, 401K and Life Insurance ($20,000 benefit).

Why Hays?

You will also get support on resume writing, interview tips, and career planning, so when there’s a position you really want, you’re fully prepared to get it.

Hays is committed to building a thriving culture of diversity that embraces people with different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better we serve our candidates, clients, and employees. We are an equal employment opportunity employer, and we comply with all applicable laws prohibiting discrimination based on race, color, creed, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity), age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, marital status, genetic information, HIV-positive status, as well as any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. One of Hays’ guiding principles is ‘do the right thing’.
We also believe that actions speak louder than words.
In that regard, we train our staff on ensuring inclusivity throughout the entire recruitment process and counsel our clients on these principles. If you have any questions about Hays or any of our processes, please contact us.

In accordance with applicable federal, state, and local law protecting qualified individuals with known disabilities, Hays will attempt to reasonably accommodate those individuals unless doing so would create an undue hardship on the company. title: Freelance Performance Data Analyst (Contract) - Contract to Hire
description:
Part-time / Remote | The Hold Label

We’re looking for an experienced and data-driven Performance Marketing Analyst to support our ongoing growth across paid and owned channels. This is a freelance/contract role with flexible hours, ideal for someone who can work independently while collaborating closely with our founder and broader creative team.

Scope of Work

You will be responsible for reviewing and optimising the performance of:

Meta Ads: Campaign setup, segmentation, budget allocation, and audience insights

Google Ads: Keyword targeting, bidding strategy, search and display optimisation

Klaviyo: Flow performance, email segmentation, A/B testing and revenue attribution

Shopify: Site analytics, page performance, CRO recommendations

Abandoned Cart Journey: End-to-end review across ads, emails, and UX

What We’re Looking For

Proven experience with Meta Ads, Google Ads, Klaviyo, and Shopify

Strong grasp of conversion funnels, retention metrics, and attribution modelling

Ability to set up or refine dashboards and clearly present insights

Proactive recommendations backed by data, not guesswork

Understanding of high-end eCommerce and fashion retail is a bonus

title: Data Analyst (App Developer) Jobs in ,,US
description:
Responsibilities:
• As a Data Analyst with a focus on App Development, you will play a crucial role in building applications that streamline data visualizations and empower bioinformatics and non-bioinformatics stakeholders.
• Will work closely with researchers to understand their needs and transform requirements into efficient, user-friendly software solutions.
• Your work will enable scientists to leverage data effectively, driving innovative research and development initiatives.
• App Development: Design, develop and refactor applications that enhance the accessibility and usability of genomic data, integrating user feedback for continuous improvement.
• Understanding User Requirements: Engage with bioinformatics research scientists to gather and analyze requirements, translating them into technical specifications and application features.
• Enabling Team Success: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure applications are aligned with common data model standards and facilitate effective data management and querying.
• Process Automation: Utilize scripting languages to automate and optimize data processing/ingestion workflows, maintaining high standards of data quality and integrity.
• ETL Process Management: Develop and execute ETL processes that align with organizational standards, ensuring seamless integration of high-value datasets.
• Documentation and Collaboration: Maintain comprehensive documentation of development processes and version control to support collaboration and reproducibility.
• Building application "access layers" for various stakeholders/teams, many are not bioinformaticians but need to have a way to work with bioinformatics data
• Harmonize & store data from different therapeutic areas
• Understanding stakeholder requirements, execute on analysis/dev tasks, refactoring code/queries, etc.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in computer science, bioinformatics, or a related field, with 3+ years of relevant experience.
• Proven experience in app development and user interface design (preferred: Rshiny).
• Strong skills in requirements gathering and translating them into actionable software solutions.
• Proficiency in PostgreSQL or similar databases, with the ability to write complex queries.
• Expertise in Python and R for automation and data manipulation.
• Familiarity with bioinformatics data and bioinformatics data standards.
• Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset, essential for partnering with diverse research teams.
• Experience with AWS desired
• Experience in API development desired
• Advanced skills with R/Python including app development (preferred: Rshiny)
• Experience with bioinformatics datasets (like BulkRNAseq, Proteomics, scRNAseq, CRISPR)
• Interaction with databases (SQL)
• Code management and documentation, usage of github

Benefits:

Healthcare Insurance: Synectics offers eligible employees and their dependents healthcare coverage through BlueCross BlueShield of Illinois. Eligibility begins on the 1st day of the calendar month following 60 days of continuous full time employment with Synectics. Premiums are subsidized by Synectics.

Dental Insurance: Synectics offers eligible employees and their dependents a dental plan through MetLife. Eligibility begins on the 1st day of the calendar month following 60 days of continuous full time employment with Synectics.

Vision Insurance: Synectics offers eligible employees vision insurance through VSP. Eligibility begins on the 1st day of the calendar month following 60 days of continuous full time employment with Synectics.401(k) Plan: The Synectics Inc. Investment Savings Retirement Plan. Synectics offers all employees who are 21 years of age or older the opportunity to invest in the 401(k) Plan on the first enrollment date that is at least 30 days after employment begins. Enrollment dates are each January 1st, April 1st, July 1st, and October 1st.

Technical Certification Bonus: Synectics is pleased to award its employees a bonus of up to $500 for an approved professional certification. In determining the bonus amount, Synectics will consider the cost of the test(s) for any certification relating to your current position, achieved during your employment with us. Only one Certification Bonus per calendar year may be awarded per employee. Only current, active employees will be eligible to receive this bonus. It will be awarded 90 days after the Synectics office has received documentation confirming the successful completion of the certification.

Synectics is an equal opportunity employer.

description:
I’m looking for a skilled Python Data Analyst to develop a churn and recurring revenue analysis system for our call center subscription service. title: Data Analyst - Contract
description:
As an IDEXX contracted Data Analyst for Reference Labs you will provide database and analytical support for multiple initiatives, projects, and programs.
• ** Our tech stack includes SQL, Snowflake, DBT, GitHub, and Tableau. ***

This position is a 40-hour (9am-3pm are key hours) hybrid with a commute onsite to Westbrook as business needs require (generally a couple times per month).

What you will do and need to succeed:
• Design, implement, and deliver standard and ad hoc reports, exception reports, measurements, and analyses to support customer-focused, data-driven analysis.
• Perform routine and ad hoc data analyses using appropriate statistical methods and graphical display standards.
• Retrieve and analyze data and present reports to management for use in supporting operations and business objectives.
• Analyze, summarize, and present information and data for discussion and decision making.
• Provide recommendations for improvement and written documentation that relates to the analysis of the data.
• Research data anomalies and issues.
• Work with data source systems and target systems to identify data issues and data gaps.
• Potentially track status and develop/update data source systems and target systems.
• Identify and recommend solutions as needed.
• Construct and apply statistical and/or models to support strategic initiatives.
• Collect data from numerous sources in various formats and translate it into a standard format.
• Perform second and third level drilldowns to add insight and understanding of results and support effective business decision making.
• Develop in-depth/advanced knowledge of various customer information systems and databases utilized by IDEXX functional groups.
• Identify, recommend and/or implement ways to leverage systems to drive customer-focused, data-driven analysis that enable continual improvement.
• Identify, recommend and drive continuous improvement in database reporting and analysis processes.
• Perform other duties as assigned.
• Adhere to and model the IDEXX Purpose & Guiding Principles.

Why IDEXX?

We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from diseases. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 10,000 talented people.

So, what does that mean for you? We enrich the livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that embraces challenges and encourages learning and discovery.   At IDEXX, you will be supported by competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement.
Let’s pursue what matters together.

IDEXX values a diverse workforce and workplace and strongly encourages women, people of color, LGBTQ+ individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply.

IDEXX is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, or any protected category prohibited by local, state, or federal laws.

title: Lead Data Analyst (100% Remote)
description:
Senior Data Analyst (100% Remote) - (Must be on W2)

Seeking a Senior Data Analyst to conduct data discovery, analysis, and mapping using SQL and other analytical tools to support data validation and integration. The ideal candidate should have strong experience in data analysis and Master Data Management (MDM), along with a few years of leadership experience.

Must have proven expertise in MDM, including workflow definition, authorization processes, and role-based access control. Requires a solid understanding of data modeling and design methodologies.

Key technical skills include SQL (or Toad), ETL, Messaging Services, API Management, and integration formats (XML, HL7, CDA). Proficiency in JSON, SQL, Power BI, Python, and Tableau is also required.

Responsibilities:
• Conduct data discovery, analysis, and mapping using SQL and analytical tools.
• Define and document business processes, workflows, and role-based access controls.
• Develop and maintain data models, quality rules, and governance frameworks.
• Perform source-to-target mappings and ensure seamless data integration.
• Support system integration testing (SIT) & user acceptance testing (UAT).

Requirements:
• 10+ years of experience in data analysis, MDM, and integration.
• 3 years in a lead role.
• Strong expertise in SQL, Power BI, Python, Tableau, ETL, APIs.
• Experience with data profiling, data modeling, and workflow automation.
• Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.

Location: 100% Remote
Duration: 9 months (extendable)

Apply now and be part of an innovative data-driven team!

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $65.00 - $70.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:
• Flexible schedule
• Paid time off
• Vision insurance

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Insight Global
description:
Insight Global is looking for a Data Analyst to join a company based in Greenwood Village, CO. This person will be working with the Product Management team to analyze reports in existing files and build reports that will track metrics, surface issues and identify opportunities for efficiencies. You will be supporting financial and budget reporting, ad-hoc sales and pricing analysis, product profitability and other needs for the business.

Essential Functions
1. Develops comprehensive monthly business review report covering standard product and/or sales reports, customer activities, such as volumes, costs, fees, and services.
2. Identifies patterns in data to assist in the development of client behavior profiles for targeting products and services.
3. Works independently with CMS Product Management, Sales and Implementation teams to monitor and report on product line Key Performance Indicators (KPI). Key areas of focus are post sale revenue realization and customer attrition.
4. Proactively supports Finance, Marketing, Sales, Agile delivery and other partners in developing their reporting and business cases for new initiatives and enhancements.
5. Provides analysis for pricing or other business changes related to CMS services.
6. Provides requested information and reporting for internal risk, compliance, and credit partners.
7. Makes recommendations for customer cross-sell strategies and other initiatives based on historical data.
8. Analyzes and interprets relevant financial statements.
9. Presents CMS reports to Senior Leaders on a regular basis.
10. Interacts directly with Associations to provide reporting that meets their needs.

We are a company committed to creating inclusive environments where people can bring their full, authentic selves to work every day. We are an equal opportunity employer that believes everyone matters. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment opportunities without regard to race, religion, sex, age, marital status, national origin, sexual orientation, citizenship status, disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or recruiting process, please send a request to HR@insightglobal.com. The EEOC "Know Your Rights" Poster is available here.

To learn more about how we collect, keep, and process your private information, please review Insight Global's Workforce Privacy Policy: https://insightglobal.com/workforce-privacy-policy/ .

title: Data Analyst (Intermediate to Senior Level – Contract / Remote) - Contract to Hire
description:
Job Overview

We are seeking a data-driven and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will analyze large datasets to extract actionable insights that inform strategic decisions across our organization. The ideal candidate combines strong technical skills with critical thinking and clear communication to turn data into stories that drive results.

You’ll work closely with product, operations, and leadership teams to build dashboards, generate reports, and surface insights that help us better understand our customers, processes, and opportunities.

Key Responsibilities

Analyze structured and unstructured data to identify patterns, trends, and insights.

Develop and maintain dashboards and reports for cross-functional stakeholders.

Perform descriptive, diagnostic, and inferential analyses to support business decisions.

Translate business questions into analytical approaches and communicate findings clearly.

Work with SQL databases and APIs to retrieve, clean, and manipulate data.

Collaborate with engineering and product teams to define tracking requirements and data pipelines.

Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide regular updates to stakeholders.

Tools & Technologies

[Customize as needed – sample stack:]

Languages: SQL, Python (pandas, numpy, matplotlib, seaborn) or R

Visualization Tools: Power BI, Tableau, Looker, Google Data Studio

Data Platforms: BigQuery, Snowflake, Redshift, PostgreSQL

Other: Excel, Jupyter, Git, Airtable

Requirements

3–6 years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.

Strong proficiency in SQL and experience working with relational databases.

Proven ability to transform business questions into analytical frameworks.

Hands-on experience with data visualization tools and presenting insights to non-technical stakeholders.

Solid understanding of statistical concepts (e.g., correlation, regression, significance testing).

Excellent attention to detail, communication, and problem-solving skills.

Nice to Have

Experience with A/B testing and experimentation frameworks.

Familiarity with dbt, Apache Airflow, or other data pipeline tools.

Exposure to machine learning or predictive modeling.

Prior experience in [e.g., health tech, fintech, e-commerce] domains.

How to Apply

Please include:

A brief introduction or cover letter

A summary of recent projects (especially those involving analysis, visualization, or business impact)

Links to dashboards or reports (if sharable), or GitHub/portfolio

Your hourly or project-based rate and availability

title: Enterprise Data Analyst / Denver, CO (Hybrid), 4+ Months Contract
description:
Job Description
Hybrid Role, Local to CO candidates only
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting decision-making processes, optimizing business operations, and driving organizational growth through data-driven strategies.

The Data Analyst will play a crucial role in supporting decision-making processes, optimizing business operations, and driving organizational growth through data-driven strategies. Data Analyst will be responsible for creation of descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive data analysis. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques, and the ability to derive actionable insights from complex datasets. That candidate would have experience in early childhood / early education / health and human services business domain and familiarity of working with the public institutions, like municipal, state or federal government.

Essential Data Analyst Duties and Responsibilities:
Development:

The Data Analyst candidate must have the following experience:
• Collect, clean, and preprocess raw data from various sources to ensure accuracy and reliability.
• Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns, trends, and insights that drive business decisions.
• Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate key metrics and findings to stakeholders.
• Utilize statistical methods and predictive modeling techniques to identify opportunities for process improvement and optimization.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and provide analytical support for strategic initiatives.
• Conduct ad-hoc analyses to address specific business questions and support decision-making processes.
• Monitor data quality and integrity, identifying and resolving discrepancies or anomalies as needed.
• Proficient with Structured Query Language (SQL) - creation of SQL queries to retrieve specific data from disparate data sources by specifying various search criteria.
• Proficient in creating, modifying, and querying relational and columnar databases.
• Demonstrated multi-year experience with AWS tech stack (Glue, S3, Athena, Redshift), Salesforce, Informatica, Snowflake, Tableau and MuleSoft .
• Strong ability to research and manage complex data requests.
• Sound oral and written communication skills.
• High evaluative and interpretive skills.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
• Proven work experience as a Data Analyst, Data Engineer , Database Developer, Data Architect, Business Analyst or similar role.
• Experience with database-backed web applications.
• Proficiency in SQL and experience with database management systems (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redshift, Snowflake).
• Familiarity with data manipulation languages and the principles of database design.
• Knowledge of software development and user interface web applications.
• Excellent organizational and analytical abilities.
• Outstanding problem solver.
• Demonstrated experience in performing of 4 types of Data Analytics
• Descriptive Analytics tells you what happened in the past.
• Diagnostic Analytics helps you understand why something happened in the past.
• Predictive Analytics predicts what is most likely to happen in the future.
• Prescriptive Analytics recommends actions you can take to affect those outcomes.
• Demonstrated experience in identifying and addressing data quality issues

Preferences:
• Experience in early childhood / early education / health and human services business domain
• Background with both structured and unstructured data.
• Experience with both SQL and NoSQL databases.
• Familiarity with columnar databases.
• Experience with Salesforce, AWS Redshift, Snowflake, Informatica, Tableau, MuleSoft.
• Physical presence in the state of Colorado
