title: Senior Product Manager, SDK & Developer Primitives
description:
Who We Are

Temporal is an open source programming model that can simplify code, make applications more reliable, and help developers focus on the important things like delivering features faster. Our amazing user community provides us with real-time feedback and contributions to improve the developer experience everywhere.

Backed by top VC firms, we have built a team of professionals from various successful start-ups and well-known technology companies. Together, we collaborate cross-functionally, engage with and support our users to improve the developer experience, deliver world-class open-source software, and enhance our commercial SaaS platform.

Temporal is growing and working towards building the best community. We are looking for those who share our values, challenge 'standard' thinking, and want to influence our future. If you have a passion for helping developer communities, open-source software, and want to be a part of our amazing team, we'd love to hear from you!

Summary

We’re looking for a Senior Product Manager, SDK & Developer Primitives to help define and evolve the core building blocks of the Temporal developer experience. In this role, you’ll partner closely with engineering to shape the core SDKs and programming model that enable developers to build fault-tolerant, distributed applications with confidence. You’ll be a key player in making complex systems feel intuitive and powerful through thoughtful design of primitives, abstractions, and developer-facing APIs.
What You'll Do
• Own and evolve the core programming primitives that make up the Temporal SDKs—ensuring they are consistent, composable, and aligned with the expectations of modern developers.
• Engage deeply with the developer community to understand how real teams use Temporal, where the abstractions help, and where they get in the way.
• Define product strategy and roadmap for Temporal’s SDK and programming model in close collaboration with product, engineering, and key design partners.
• Translate complex technical requirements into simple, usable, and scalable developer experiences.
• Collaborate with teams across SDKs, server, and web UI to ensure a cohesive and forward-looking developer platform.
• Represent the voice of the developer in all product decisions, ensuring the tools we build help users ship reliable systems with less cognitive overhead.
What You'll Bring
• A strong technical foundation and the ability to dive deep with engineers—experience working with developer platforms, SDKs, APIs, or infrastructure products is required.
• Hands-on experience writing code in one or more languages (e.g., Go, Java, TypeScript, Python, Rust, etc.).
• Prior experience building or contributing to developer tools, programming models, or infrastructure abstractions.
• A developer-first mindset and a passion for improving the ergonomics, usability, and clarity of complex systems.
• Ability to turn ambiguous problems into clear product requirements and prioritize trade-offs to deliver impact quickly.
• Strong understanding of Product Management fundamentals, including product lifecycle management, market research, roadmap development, prioritization, and translating customer needs into actionable product requirements
• 5+ years of experience in Product Management, or a hybrid background that includes software engineering and product work.
• Knowledge of distributed systems is a plus.

Compensation
• The estimated pay range for this role is $180,000 - $230,000.
• Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Temporal's equity plan.

Compensation ranges reflect salary and commission compensation (when applicable) across several geographic markets. Employment offers carefully consider multiple factors, including prior experience, knowledge, expertise, skillset, market location, and job level assessed during the interview process.

Employee benefits and perks below are for full-time employees, part-time or temporary positions are excluded.

U.S. Benefits
• Unlimited PTO, 12 Holidays + 2 Floating Holidays
• 100% Premiums Coverage for Medical, Dental, and Vision
• AD&D, LT & ST Disability, and Life Insurance (Standard & Supplemental Available)
• Empower 401K Plan
• Additional Perks for Learning & Development, Lifestyle Spending, In-Home Office Setup, Professional Memberships, WFH Meals, Internet Stipend and more!

International Benefits
• Paid Time Off (PTO) and Benefits outside the United States vary by country, and are issued in partnership with Remote.com. Additionally, Temporal offers perks to all international employees for learning & career development, a lifestyle spending account, in-home office setup (in addition to company-issued hardware), professional memberships, work-from-home meals, and access to the Calm app for mental wellness.

Additional Perks
• $3,600 / Year Work from Home Meals
• $1,500 / Year Career Development & Learning
• $1,200 / Year Lifestyle Spending Account
• $1,000 / Year In-Home Office Setup (In addition to Temporal issued equipment - laptop, monitor, keyboard, mouse, trackpad, and extension power cable at no cost to you)
• $500 / Year Professional Memberships
• $74 / Month Reimbursement for Internet
• Calm App Subscription for Mental Health & Wellness

Temporal Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Temporal Technologies does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. We embrace and celebrate differences and diversity.

Temporal is committed to providing access, equal opportunity, and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. If you need to request a reasonable accommodation, please let your Recruiter know so we can assist.

We are not working with external recruitment agencies, thanks.

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
The final salary or hourly wage, as applicable, paid to each candidate/applicant for this position is ultimately dependent on a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, the candidate’s/applicant’s qualifications, skills, and level of experience as well as the geographical location of the position.

Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Sponsorship not available.

Our client is seeking a Senior Product Manager in Denver, CO.

Role Description
The Senior Product Manager, Financial Planning and Forecasting, will lead the design, development, and execution of financial planning and forecasting solutions. This role requires expertise in creating and managing enterprise financial tools, with specific experience in platforms such as Anaplan and Oracle Financials. The Senior Product Manager will be responsible for crafting a product roadmap that enhances forecasting accuracy and optimizes human capital while ensuring alignment with organizational goals. This position is critical to driving data-informed decision-making and delivering measurable business outcomes.
The Senior Product Manager will work closely with cross-functional teams, including finance, operations, engineering, and data analytics, to deliver solutions that integrate seamlessly with enterprise systems. Core responsibilities include managing the full product lifecycle—from identifying opportunities and gathering requirements to prioritizing features and launching impactful solutions. The role requires the ability to translate business needs into actionable product plans, manage competing priorities, and deliver scalable, user-centric tools. The candidate must also demonstrate strong communication skills to align with executive stakeholders, provide regular updates, and present product performance metrics.

• Ensures seamless collaboration with business and technology for responsive support for impactful product deliveries
• Crafts a multi-year product vision, articulating the value proposition and ensuring alignment to company strategic vision without support.
• Evangelizes vision across the organization and the company where appropriate
• Defines the approach to deliver to the broader product vision, in context with the domain, and developing a plan to effect success criteria and product value.
• Breaks down roadmaps into releasable features without support and owns the prioritization and sequencing of those features to best support strategic goals.
• Prioritizes feature backlog, accounting for complexity, impact, and cohesion with business unit strategy
• Orchestrates comprehensive product planning sessions within their domain and across dependencies.
• Leads customer research and independently synthesizes insights to develop a deep understanding of relevant product opportunities
• Demonstrates a deep understanding of market value and trends (including competitor products) and incorporates into product roadmaps.
• Writes complete user stories and acceptance criteria within domain and influences across domains.
• Drives progress against deliverables across their broader domain, proactively managing risks and dependencies so that outcomes are achieved
• Determines testing strategy and other acceptance criteria requirements
• Engages cross-functionally to ensure incidents are appropriately triaged and addressed. Communicates impacts across the business without support.
• Prioritizes product roadmap to balance short-term deliverables with long term progress, across multiple domains with support.
• Develops feature timeline and sequencing plan within a product line, considering technical and operational constraints and delivery of iterative value without support.

Skills & Requirements

• 6+ years in the product management discipline
• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent experience
• Ability to inspire others, including demonstrated experience managing and leading strong teams
• Ability to partner effectively to define, measure and analyze processes to identify improvement opportunities
• Technical background and understanding of software development principles, including Agile development, and testing methodologies
• Proven track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle
• Proficient in data analysis and performance metrics
• Strong critical thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills
• Ability to explain complex technical material clearly to users with varying levels of proficiency
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including presenting to various levels within a matrixed organization
• Outstanding organizational and time management skills
• Finance or Accounting background
• Practical experience with Anaplan and Oracle Financials

Benefits/Other Compensation

This position is a contract/temporary role where Hays offers you the opportunity to enroll in full medical benefits, dental benefits, vision benefits, 401K and Life Insurance ($20,000 benefit).

Why Hays?

You will be working with a professional recruiter who has intimate knowledge of the industry and market trends. Your Hays recruiter will lead you through a thorough screening process in order to understand your skills, experience, needs, and drivers. You will also get support on resume writing, interview tips, and career planning, so when there’s a position you really want, you’re fully prepared to get it.

Nervous about an upcoming interview? Unsure how to write a new resume?

Visit the Hays Career Advice section to learn top tips to help you stand out from the crowd when job hunting.

Hays is committed to building a thriving culture of diversity that embraces people with different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better we serve our candidates, clients, and employees. We are an equal employment opportunity employer, and we comply with all applicable laws prohibiting discrimination based on race, color, creed, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity), age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, marital status, genetic information, HIV-positive status, as well as any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. One of Hays’ guiding principles is ‘do the right thing’.
We also believe that actions speak louder than words.
In that regard, we train our staff on ensuring inclusivity throughout the entire recruitment process and counsel our clients on these principles. If you have any questions about Hays or any of our processes, please contact us.

In accordance with applicable federal, state, and local law protecting qualified individuals with known disabilities, Hays will attempt to reasonably accommodate those individuals unless doing so would create an undue hardship on the company. Any qualified applicant or consultant with a disability who requires an accommodation in order to perform the essential functions of the job should call or text 813.336.5570.

Drug testing may be required; please contact a recruiter for more information.

#LI-DNI
#1169477 - Renee Theoret

title: Senior Product Manager (Contract to hire)
description:
At WISEcode, we're a well-funded, dynamic startup. WISEcode makes personalized nutrition a reality based on the facts – what truly is in our food — and marries this data with your preferences. Powered by AI and the world’s best food and nutrition database, WISEcode embraces the fact that we are all different, have different dietary needs, objectives, and preferences, and should not be at the mercy of market spin or “expert” opinion. Every one of us should have the information we need to make the best decisions for ourselves.

We are looking for a startup minded, accomplished Senior Product Manager with a proven track record of successfully developing, launching and scaling consumer app products (Ideally 0 to 1). The ideal candidate has a deep understanding of consumer market trends, the nutrition and health & wellness landscape, coupled with strong product leadership skills. You will work closely with the founder of the company, product designers, data scientists, nutrition scientists, software developers, marketers, and other stakeholders to drive product development and create compelling customer experiences.

Key Responsibilities:

● Utilize your in-depth understanding of consumer behavior and preferences to develop and execute unique and differentiated product strategies that disrupt the food and nutrition industry

● Lead the product development lifecycle, from ideation to launch, ensuring alignment with company objectives and consumer feedback

● Collaborate closely with design, engineering, marketing, and data analytics teams to create product roadmaps and prioritize features based on market trends, user feedback, and business goals

● Employ A/B testing methodologies to continuously optimize product features, user flows, and conversion rates, making data-driven decisions to enhance the user experience

● Participate in product testing and quality assurance to ensure a high standard of performance

● Champion user-centered design principles, conducting user research, interviews, and usability testing to gather insights and refine product designs

● Develop and maintain wireframes, prototypes, and mockups to visualize and communicate design concepts effectively to internal teams and stakeholders

● Analyze product metrics, user feedback, and market trends to iterate on existing products and identify new features or enhancements

● Create comprehensive and well-structured documentation, including product specifications, user stories, and user guides, to ensure clear communication across cross-functional teams

● Document key decisions, feature requirements, and project updates to facilitate seamless collaboration and knowledge sharing throughout the product development lifecycle

● Research industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitor offerings to identify opportunities for differentiation and innovation, ensuring our products achieve the forefront of the market

Qualifications:

● 8+ years of proven experience in consumer product management, with a strong track record of successful product launches, especially 0 to 1

title: Product Manager
description:
Senior Product Manager

Long Term-Contract (High Likelihood of Extension)

Greenwood, CO

Rate: 65-70/hr

The Product Manager II (Experience Manager) will be responsible for the strategy, execution, and delivery of customer-facing digital experiences for customers. This role is pivotal in driving cross-functional initiatives aimed at enhancing customer satisfaction while aligning with broader business objectives. The ideal candidate is highly collaborative, detail-oriented, and possesses a strong understanding of customer experience design and Agile methodologies.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing the roadmap, pricing, packaging, and documentation of new product ideas. By maintaining a good customer and market knowledge, this candidate will be able to successfully build and iterate on our products.

Responsibilities
• Define the product vision and drive the roadmap for our products
• Internalize and represent the customers' voice throughout the product lifecycle
• Collect and measure key product metrics against goals to inform success of each release and plan iterations accordingly
• Translate market trends into a compelling product direction and vision

Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Engineering or related field of study
• 5+ years' experience in product management
• Experience with tools like JIRA, Confluence, and Slack

ABOUT EIGHT ELEVEN:

At Eight Eleven, our business is people. Relationships are at the center of what we do. A successful partnership is only as strong as the relationship built. We’re your trusted partner for IT hiring, recruiting and staffing needs.

For over 16 years, Eight Eleven has established and maintained relationships that are designed to meet your IT staffing needs. Whether it’s contract, contract-to-hire, or permanent placement work, we customize our search based upon your company's unique initiatives, culture and technologies. With our national team of recruiters placed at 21 major hubs around the nation, Eight Eleven finds the people best-suited for your business. When you work with us, we work with you. That’s the Eight Eleven promise.

Eight Eleven Group provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, citizenship, disability, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

title: Product Manager III
description:
Payrate: $57.85 - $57.85/hr.

Summary:
We are seeking a talented and dynamic product marketer to drive inbound product marketing and outbound go-to market strategy focused on our advertising initiatives, which includes our seller-facing advertising products. This is a unique opportunity to become an integral part of the marketing team working with the product teams to support initiatives for our advertising suite of products. This role will partner cross-functionally with product, design, engineering, analytics, communications, customer service, and market teams.
To be successful, you are an experienced product marketer with expertise in developing value propositions, positioning, and generating demand for products and tools, ideally in an e-commerce or marketplace setting. The ideal candidate will have experience with digital ad products.

Responsibilities:
• You are responsible for the product value proposition narrative, the go-to-market strategy, and messaging for advertising initiatives, ensuring seller success on the platform.
• You will approach go-to-market in a holistic manner to ensure sellers deliver relevant and meaningful communications at the right time and place across in-product, marketing, pr, market communities, sales, customer service, and partner messaging.
• Influence product roadmaps by synthesizing market, customer and competitive insights, build audience segmentations and opportunity sizing.
• Create customer feedback loops during the product and marketing development process to refine the product narrative and value proposition articulation.
• Develop product value propositions, narratives, customer messaging, naming and external facing proof points.
• Manage the go-to-market strategy and planning for product launches and then lead through channel experts to ensure execution and impact measurement. Track customer engagement, product adoption, and business success. Partner with channel experts across marketing, pr communications, customer service, in-market teams, and sales channels to generate demand.
• Identify internal product market fit tracking metrics; synthesize customer feedback to provide signal amidst the noise across the product life cycle: development, launch, and optimization / expansion. Build up the value proposition leveraging the voice of the customer to optimize product marketing messaging and to advise on product recommendations.
• Define key metrics for success, and track progress against goals for the product launches and in-market growth adoption of existing products or services.

Requirements:
• 6+ years of experience in product marketing
• Strong track record of developing product and go to market strategies at ecommerce companies or within
• Vertical-focused organizations at e-commerce companies
• Preferred experience in digital advertising
• Proven ability to drive innovation, execute projects with excellence
• Success working collaboratively with cross-functional teams and excellent communication skills
• Strong data analysis skills and experience with customer research techniques

Pay Transparency: The typical base pay for this role across the U.S. is: $57.85 - $57.85/hr. Final offer amounts, within the base pay set forth above, are determined by factors including your relevant skills, education and experience and the benefits package you select. Full-time employees are eligible to select from different benefits packages. Packages may include medical, dental, and vision benefits, 10 paid days off, 401(k) plan participation, commuter benefits and life and disability insurance.

title: Product Manager Needed for Advanced Blender Project
description:
We are seeking an experienced Product Manager to lead our Advanced Blender Project. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in product management, particularly in the software or 3D modeling industry. You will be responsible for defining the product vision, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and ensuring timely delivery of project milestones. Your expertise will help us shape the product to meet user needs effectively. If you're passionate about innovative technologies and have a track record of successful project management, we'd love to hear from you!

Responsibilities:

Define the product vision and ensure it meets market needs.

Coordinate between CAD designers, embedded system designers, enclosure manufacturers, and other stakeholders.

Make key decisions regarding the motor and electrical components.

Manage the project timeline and ensure key milestones are met.

Oversee the quality of the final product to ensure it meets all standards and requirements.

Ensure compliance with local and international safety standards (e.g., BIS, UL, CE).

Requirements:

Proven experience in product management, preferably in consumer electronics or kitchen appliances.

Strong project management skills and ability to coordinate with multiple teams.

Excellent communication and leadership skills.

Knowledge of regulatory standards and compliance for electronic appliances.

Ability to make data-driven decisions and manage project budgets.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with smart home devices or IoT products.

Familiarity with CAD software and embedded systems.

Strong understanding of manufacturing processes and material selection.

title: Technical Product Manager – AI/ML and Generative AI Projects (100% Remote) W2 Only
description:
• 1 year contract opportunity - W2 (No C2C)
• Compensation: $80 - $88/hr
• 100% Remote

Intuitive Surgical, in cooperation with our recruitment partner Raise, are hiring. We’re a global technology leader in minimally invasive care and a pioneer of robotic-assisted surgery. Working closely with hospital teams, we’re developing integrated solutions that help enable physicians to get patients back to what matters most. Our technology has been used in nearly 10 million operations across 67 countries.

Together, we’ve dedicated more than two decades for innovating for better care through enhanced experiences, improved efficiencies, and reduced cost of care. In this role, you will join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients.

Primary Function of Position:

Seeking a Technical Product Manager with expertise in AI/ML and Generative AI initiatives, particularly with Microsoft Azure, AWS or Google Cloud platforms and Computer Vision and NLP/LLM technologies. The role requires managing the end-to-end lifecycle of technical projects, from ideation through implementation, with an emphasis on AI-driven solutions.

Responsible for the technical management of platform and application development projects, this role demands a strategic approach to integrating AI capabilities across business functions. The manager ensures adherence to internal processes and legal compliance without overlooking any critical steps such as data and process security. They facilitate decision-making and compliance while keeping pace with project demands.

Roles & Responsibilities:
• Manage complex AI/ML and GAI project lifecycles from conception to implementation.
• Align cross-functional teams around AI/ML project goals and technical requirements.
• Navigate the technical aspects of Azure-based AI solutions, ensuring seamless integration and adoption.
• Participate in strategy and planning for AI-based platform development and business application integration.
• Present project plans, progress, and strategies in cross-functional and team meetings.
• Manage KPIs, monitoring, and user feedback for AI/ML projects.
• Collaborate with business partners to integrate AI/ML solutions into business processes.
• Contribute to internal and external communications regarding AI trends and technology adoption.

Project Management Roles & Responsibilities:
• Lead project planning and execution, ensuring alignment with AI/ML and GAI strategies.
• Engage stakeholders across functions including Finance, Manufacturing, Operations, and IT.
• Communicate project status and manage risks related to AI/ML projects.

Skills, Experience, Education, & Training:
• Strong communication, leadership, and project management in a technical AI/ML environment.
• Experience in Manufacturing Operations with Azure AI platform preferred.
• Certification in project management (PMP) or Scrum Master (CSM) beneficial.
• BS or equivalent work experience in a related technical field.

Project Skills & Experience:
• Technical project delivery experience in AI/ML and GAI on Azure, AWS or Google Cloud
• Demonstrated leadership in cross-functional teams for technical AI/ML project rollouts.
• Proficiency in Azure services, AI/ML Ops, and data management best practices.
• Strong technical project management experience in AI/ML and cloud technologies (Azure preferred).
• Proven ability in leading cross-functional teams and managing complex technical projects.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills.
• Knowledge of software development lifecycle, especially in regulated environments.
• Experience with AI/ML Ops platforms and data management.
• Bachelor's degree in a related field; PMP or equivalent certification preferred.

Please note that this is a contract role providing services to Intuitive through our direct sourcing partner, Raise who manages Intuitive’s Contractor Talent Community. If you are selected for this role, you will be employed by Raise and will not be an employee of Intuitive.

Work with an Award Winning Employer:
• Best Places to Work, Glassdoor Employees’ Choice, 2019 (#12 of 100), 2020 (#7 of 100)
• America’s Best Midsized Employers, Forbes, 2019 (#149 of 500)
• Top 150 Places to Work in Healthcare, Becker’s Hospital Review, 2019
• Top CEOs, Glassdoor, 2019 (#9 of 100)

Raise and Intuitive are Equal Employment Opportunity Employers. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type, without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws. We will consider for employment all qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws.

Int22

title: Product Manager -- US
description:
Job Title: Product Manager – AI Audit & Automation Products

Location: Remote

Engagement Type: Contract (Potential for Ongoing / Full-Time)

About ARBO AI

ARBO AI is transforming how enterprise and government organizations identify and unlock automation opportunities through strategic AI audits. Our flagship diagnostic platform, Hydra, has already been deployed across multimillion-dollar construction, defense, and logistics organizations to uncover untapped ROI and drive tech-enabled operational change.

We're seeking a sharp, strategic Product Manager to help lead the development and scaling of our audit delivery systems, automation playbooks, and roadmap for enterprise-facing products. You'll play a key role in shaping the tools, templates, and user experiences that power high-value insights — with a chance to directly impact the digital transformation of some of the world's most complex businesses.

Core Responsibilities

Product Strategy & Roadmapping

Develop and refine the product roadmap for our AI audit platform, working closely with leadership and consulting teams.

Translate consulting IP, frameworks, and field-tested methodologies into scalable, tech-enabled product components.

Align roadmap to internal growth goals, enterprise client needs, and emerging use cases.

Requirements Management

Define clear user stories and functional requirements across audit phases (data ingestion, AI analysis, report generation).

Prioritize features in collaboration with executive and engineering teams to balance velocity, stability, and innovation.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

Partner with engineers, audit analysts, UI/UX designers, and QA to drive high-quality sprint outcomes.

Serve as the connective tissue between field consultants, internal leadership, and the product team.

Research & Competitive Analysis

Conduct internal discovery and industry research to inform feature development.

Benchmark audit tools and AI solutions in the enterprise/GovTech space for differentiation opportunities.

Metrics & Success Tracking

Define and monitor KPIs such as audit delivery time, audit quality scores, report reuse rates, and stakeholder adoption.

Drive feedback loops with consulting teams to improve product-market fit across domains (construction, defense, staffing, etc.).

Stakeholder Alignment

Act as the product lead for client-facing teams and enterprise partners.

Communicate roadmap decisions, feature status, and dependencies with clarity and urgency.

Key Skills & Qualifications

3+ years of product management experience, ideally in B2B, SaaS, or enterprise workflow tools.

Experience working in agile environments; familiarity with tools like ClickUp, Notion, or Jira.

Comfortable interfacing with engineers on topics like APIs, dashboards, data structures, and automation logic.

Ability to distill complex strategy and audit frameworks into simple product requirements.

Data-driven mindset with experience analyzing usage metrics and driving iteration from insight.

Strong writing and presentation skills — capable of aligning cross-functional stakeholders around a shared roadmap.

Bonus: Experience with consulting, GovTech, AI/ML workflows, or enterprise audit/reporting tools.

📈 Sample KPIs

On-Time Delivery: % of audit product features deployed on schedule

Internal Adoption: Usage rates of audit playbooks, templates, or tools by consulting teams

Audit Velocity: Average time to produce final reports using productized tools

Stakeholder Feedback: NPS or qualitative feedback from consulting leads and enterprise clients

Platform Impact: % of audits that incorporate platform-generated data insights or modules

What You’ll Get

Remote-First Flexibility: Results-focused team with asynchronous work culture

Direct Impact: You'll help shape a product that transforms operations at billion-dollar organizations

High Autonomy: Work with a small, elite team moving fast

Frontline Exposure: You'll sit at the intersection of consulting, AI, and product strategy

title: Product Owner/Portfolio Manager (AI/ML Focused)
description:
Seeking an AI focused Product Owner/Portfolio Manager to support enterprise wide AI / ML implementations and product teams to ensure clarity in strategic direction. We are seeking candidates who can bring an expertise to lead and manage project requirements and introduces new, beneficial tools and practices. Focuses on managing the development of AI/ML products to meet the needs of internal and external clients, and helps to establish the business value for their development and implementation. Provides business point of view and guidance on opportunities and risks to support clients.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
-20% Leads the development of the product portfolio and provides workable solutions to satisfy customer and market expectations in close collaboration with stakeholders, Product Owners, and scrum teams.
-15% Collaborates with management to identify and plan product releases by reviewing milestones with stakeholders; manages the continual development of existing products.
-15% Validates proposed solutions by performing market research to gain insights and inform; assists with pricing packages and structures.
-10% Communicates internally and externally, develops and maintains Product Roadmap(s).
-10% Manages Product Backlog(s) for the development teams by using product road mapping and backlog management tools.
-10% Works closely with testing managers to ensure product functionality is properly tested against business requirements; leads change control processes to reflect project priorities.
-5% Aides in the development process by attending product refinement, sprint planning, and sprint reviews.
-5% Coordinates and organizes workshops with product users using the discover and define approach; validates hypotheses and implements best solutions.
-5% Contributes to wider initiatives and activities that support and increase customer satisfaction.
-5% Conducts product training to partners, staff, and identifies need for individual/team training opportunities.

Required Skills

-Education Level: Bachelor's Degree. In lieu of a Bachelor's degree, an additional 4 years of relevant work experience is required in addition to the required work experience.
-Experience: 8+ years experience as a Product Owner
-Minimum of 1-2 AI Product Implementations as a Product Owner. Experience within agile process and principles is required. Must have implemented AI products from scratch. New implementation AI experience is critically important to the success of this position.
- Prior experience managing a portfolio of AI implementation projects (capturing info, discussing ideas, driving to conclusions, implementation of the AI product within depts). Driving the product portfolio with the hands on team members to ensure completion. Knowledge on how to capture AI requirements/use cases for implementing AI into an established environment without AI services. AI Planning. Generative AI would be preferred.
-Must have outstanding communication and presentation abilities. This position requires presentations to stakeholders and upper management to share product implementation updates
- Comfortable navigating ambiguity and driving clarity in new or emerging AI initiatives.
- Ability to balance long-term strategy with short-term execution, ensuring incremental delivery of AI projects with measurable outcomes.
- Proven experience working on AI products or supporting AI department planning and strategy.
-Strong knowledge and understanding of AI and Generative AI technologies, trends, and business requirements.
-Exceptional communication skills to lead, facilitate, and drive conversations with senior management and stakeholders for AI ideation, strategic alignment, and exploration.
-Expertise in developing and delivering compelling presentations and decks to showcase AI use cases, feasibility studies, and outcomes to both technical and non-technical audiences.
-Experience supporting department-level planning, particularly within data science, AI, or similar technical domains, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and priorities.
-Ability to identify, explore, and prioritize AI use cases across multiple business units, translating business needs into actionable plans and product requirements.
-Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to assess AI opportunities, risks, and feasibility.
-Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams (engineering, data science, business owners, etc.) to align product goals with AI strategies.
-Knowledge of Agile methodologies and frameworks (e.g., SAFe), with a focus on integrating AI solutions within product planning and delivery cycles.

Preferred Qualifications
-Previous healthcare experience
-Any sort of Agile and/or Product Owner related certifications

title: Technical Product Manager With Dev Knowledge & Experience - Contract to Hire
description:
Technical Project Manager (With Development Knowledge) – Help Us Build a Game-Changing Platform

We’re looking for a rockstar Technical Project Manager who knows how to drive product builds, manage outsourced developers, and speak the language of code.

We’re a fast-growing healthcare company building a custom software platform to manage complex workflows, integrate with third-party systems, and support our explosive growth. We're currently working with an external dev team and need someone who can own the execution—from project planning to sprint management to QA.

🔧 What You’ll Be Doing:

Serve as the bridge between business and engineering

Translate business needs into clear specs and actionable tasks

Own the project plan, timeline, backlog, and deliverables

Coordinate daily/weekly check-ins with developers (mostly offshore)

Help review code, validate API logic, and catch technical gaps

Define and run QA / UAT cycles before launch

Track project velocity and unblock issues fast

💻 Must-Have Skills:

Strong technical background (you don’t need to be a dev, but you should understand architecture, APIs, and common dev workflows)

Proven experience managing SaaS or custom platform builds

Fluent in tools like Jira, ClickUp, Postman, Notion, GitHub, Figma, Slack

Excellent communicator and clear documenter

Experience managing outsourced/offshore dev teams

Comfortable in Agile environments and running sprints

🚀 Bonus Points If You Have:

Experience in healthcare, DME, or regulated industries

Light dev experience (enough to run queries, understand code structure, etc.)

Product management experience (roadmaps, feature planning, user flows)

📅 Project Scope:

This is an ongoing role. We’re in build mode now but will continue to iterate long-term. Initial engagement will be part-time (10–20 hrs/week), with the possibility of expanding into a larger role if it’s a good fit.

Excellent communicator and clear documenter
Experience managing outsourced/offshore dev teams
Comfortable in Agile environments and running sprints
Experience in healthcare, DME, or regulated industries
Light dev experience (enough to run queries, understand code structure, etc.)
Product management experience (roadmaps, feature planning, user flows)

title: Digital Product Manager – Personalization & Analytics Platform (Contract)
description:
Bounteous is a premier end-to-end digital transformation consultancy dedicated to partnering with ambitious brands to create digital solutions for today’s complex challenges and tomorrow’s opportunities. With uncompromising standards for technical and domain expertise, we deliver innovative and strategic solutions in Strategy, Analytics, Digital Engineering, Cloud, Data & AI, Experience Design, and Marketing.

Our Co-Innovation methodology is a unique engagement model designed to align interests and accelerate value creation. Our clients worldwide benefit from the skills and expertise of over 4,000+ expert team members across the Americas, APAC, and EMEA. By partnering with leading technology providers, we craft transformative digital experiences that enhance customer engagement and drive business success.

Data-driven digital product leader to manage our analytics and personalization platform portfolio. This role is responsible for driving the strategy, development, and performance of data-enabling technologies that power personalized, omnichannel guest experiences. The ideal candidate brings deep expertise in digital measurement strategy, analytics platform ownership (e.g., Google Analytics, Mixpanel), and cross-functional collaboration to turn data into actionable insights across web, mobile, and in-store touchpoints. This position plays a critical role in aligning product decisions with business intelligence and customer engagement goals.

Information Security Responsibilities
• Promote and enforce awareness of key information security practices, including acceptable use of information assets, malware protection, and password security protocols
• Identify, assess, and report security risks, focusing on how these risks impact the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information assets
• Understand and evaluate how data is stored, processed, or transmitted, ensuring compliance with data privacy and protection standards (GDPR, CCPA, etc.)
• Ensure data protection measures are integrated throughout the information lifecycle to safeguard sensitive information

Key Responsibilities:
• Lead the strategy, development, and continuous improvement of a portfolio of products supporting marketing technology, loyalty, personalization, and data platforms.
• Drive product initiatives that support cross-functional activation of personalized guest experiences across a variety of channels including mobile app, web, in-store kiosks, email, SMS, and digital fuel pump screens.
• Serve as primary owner and point of contact for web and product analytics platforms (e.g., Adobe Target, Google Analytics, Mixpanel), partnering closely with BI and Advanced Analytics teams to support measurement planning, reporting requirements, and implementation documentation (BRDs, SDRs).
• Define and manage product KPIs, ensuring they are mapped directly to Pilot's strategic growth and customer engagement objectives. Develop and maintain product roadmaps in alignment with business priorities.
• Collaborate with stakeholders across Marketing, Technology, Loyalty, Data Science, and Operations to deliver scalable, personalized experiences and enhance the digital guest journey.

Qualifications:
• Strong understanding of customer data platforms, digital analytics, A/B testing, and marketing automation technologies
• Hands-on experience managing analytics tools such as Adobe Target, Google Analytics and Mixpanel, with an understanding of tracking strategies and reporting workflows
• Proven ability to influence without authority and manage multiple initiatives across cross-functional teams
• Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
• Experience in retail, convenience, or other guest-centric, omnichannel environments

We invite you to stay connected with us by subscribing to our monthly job openings alert here.

Research shows that women and other underrepresented groups apply only if they meet 100% of the criteria of a job posting. If you have passion and intelligence, and possess a technical knack (even if you’re missing some of the above), we encourage you to apply.

Bounteous is focused on promoting an inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate the different viewpoints and experiences our diverse group of team members bring to Bounteous. Bounteous does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

In addition, you have the opportunity to participate in several Team Member Networks, sometimes referred to as employee resource groups (ERGs), that host space with individuals with shared identities, interests, and passions. Our Team Member Networks celebrate communities of color, life as a working parent or caregiver, the 2SLGBTQIA+ community, wellbeing, and more. Regardless of your respective identity, there are various avenues we involve team members in the Bounteous community.

Bounteous is willing to sponsor eligible candidates for employment visas.

#BI-Remote

#LI-Remote

title: Comcast Connectivity Product Management Co-op
description: Comcast Business offers a suite of Connectivity, Communications, Networking, Cybersecurity, Wireless, and Managed Solutions to help global organizations of all sizes prepare for what’s next. Powered by the nation’s largest Gig-speed broadband network and backed by 24/7 customer support, Comcast Business is the nation’s largest technology provider to small businesses and one of the leading service providers to the Enterprise market. Comcast Business has been consistently recognized by industry analysts and associations as a leader and innovator, and one of the fastest growing providers of Ethernet services. Job Summary Job Description Program Overview Discover opportunities designed to set your career in motion! The Comcast internship/co-op program will help you cultivate meaningful relationships, develop strong interpersonal and business skills, gain exposure to the day-to-day operations of a Fortune 40 media and technology company, and receive mentorship opportunities to expand your professional network. This program immerses students into the daily operation of a contemporary media and technology company while working side-by-side with Comcast’s top innovators. The student becomes an integral part of the Comcast team working on creative, innovative, and thought-provoking projects within various business units. Organization & Team Overview Comcast Business offers technology solutions ranging from Ethernet, internet, and Wi-Fi connectivity to voice, television, and managed Enterprise solutions to power businesses of all sizes to perform better. From small businesses to mid-market and large Enterprise organizations, Comcast Business serves business customers across the country. Powered by an advanced, Gig-speed network and backed by 24/7 technical support, Comcast Business is one of the largest contributors to the growth of Comcast Cable. The organization is the nation’s largest cable provider to small and mid-size businesses and has emerged as a force in the Enterprise market, recognized by leading industry associations as one of the fastest growing provider of Ethernet services. Role Description Are you ready to dive in and be a part of the team supporting one the most excited and rapidly growing products in the industry? Join us as a Connectivity Product Management Co-op, where you will work supporting the Dedicated Internet product within the Connectivity Product Organization. In this role, you will work on cutting-edge technology that is revolutionizing the way businesses access the internet. You will be at the heart of a complex, fast-paced environment with endless opportunities for learning and growth. As a part of a high-energy team of industry experts, you will contribute to shaping the vision of a product that is changing the internet landscape. As a key member of the product management team you will help guide product strategy, make crucial decisions, and collaborate with the best minds in the business. You will get hands-on experience working on everything from technical analysis to market strategy, gaining deep insights into how products are developed and deployed. As a Product Management Co-op you will get to interact with and influence every aspect of the business including operations, finance, marketing, and technology. What are some interesting problems the student will work on? In your role, you will get to work on a variety of exciting challenges related to the rapidly growing Dedicated Internet product offering. You will have an opportunity to engage in both technical analysis and business-focused tasks including research, development, and deployment of new technologies, as well as lifecycle sustainment of existing products. From assessing the latest technology to optimizing processes, your work will be integral to developing innovative solutions that enhance the product and improve customer experience. Where can this student make an impact? Your impact will be felt across multiple areas of the business, from improving operational efficiency to contributing to better customer experiences. You will play a critical role in streamlining processes, identifying opportunities for growth, and directly influencing product success. With exposure to all aspects of the product lifecycle, your contributions will lead to smoother workflows, higher customer satisfaction, and increased sales and revenue. In this dynamic role, you will get exposure to the full business cycle, from ideation to deployment, to make a tangible difference in the company’s success Job Responsibilities Responsibilities include but are not limited to: Collaborates with cross-functional teams to support the launch of new services, features, and enhancements on time and within budget Assists the product manager in gathering input to define product concepts, develop product requirements and build implementation plans Aids in maintaining the product roadmap, tracking deadlines, and ensuring tasks are completed on time Contributes to the creation and maintenance of user guides, FAQs, and other product documentation to support internal teams and customers Conducts market research to identify market trends Supports the collection and analysis of data related to product performance, customer feedback, and market trends Takes initiative in gathering information, exercising judgement and proactively suggesting areas of opportunity Develops an understanding of the full product lifecycle, from ideation to post-launch evaluation Other duties and responsibilities as assigned. Preferred Skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Microsoft Suite (PowerPoint, Excel, Word) Familiarity with product and program management tools (Jira/Smartsheet) Preferred Majors: Business, Economics, Engineering, Communications, Finance Minimum Qualifications and Eligibility Requirements Currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree from Drexel University, with a cooperative learning track. Available to work 40 hours per week for 6 months starting September 22, 2025, through March 27, 2026. Authorized to work in the United States with no current or future sponsorship needs Available to report in-person to the work location on the job posting Comcast is an Affirmative Action/EEO employer M/F/D/V Skills Accountability, Communication, Professional Etiquette, Relationship Building, Resilience, Teamwork Compensation Base Pay: $23.00 Base pay is one part of the Total Rewards that Comcast provides to compensate and recognize employees for their work. Most sales positions are eligible for a Commission under the terms of an applicable plan, while most non-sales positions are eligible for a Bonus. Additionally, Comcast provides best-in-class Benefits to eligible employees. We believe that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most, and should help you care for those who matter most. That’s why we provide an array of options, expert guidance and always-on tools, that are personalized to meet the needs of your reality – to help support you physically, financially and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life. Please visit the compensation and benefits summary on our careers site for more details. The application window is 30 days from the date job is posted, unless the number of applicants requires it to close sooner or later. Education Certifications (if applicable) Relevant Work Experience 0-2 Years Comcast is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. At Comcast , you have the power to connect the world. Your career options are endless as you grow in your career. Explore your future with access to a variety of teams, locations, and resources in an expanding network. You can also explore additional opportunities at our company, NBCUniversal.

title: Senior Commercialization Manager - Remote
description:
The Opportunity:

The Senior Commercialization Manager will perform similar duties as the Commercialization Manager yet be responsible for special initiatives and projects. The role will manage enterprise-wide initiatives, serving as a project manager to help deliver and accomplish organizational goals.

The role will oversee the management, coordination and execution of all aspects of ongoing product commercialization efforts. This role leads commercialization “go-to-market” team(s) and plans, organizes and controls all commercialization activities. The role develops and oversees multiple product plans and implementation schedules, directing and tracking resources and combined tasks to ensure successful delivery of products and ability to onboarding & implement new products & solutions. The Commercialization Manager works cross functionally across all teams within the organization, external vendors and Clients.

Day In The Life:
• Support other Commercialization Managers, including onboarding support and ongoing process improvement.
• Lead Communities of Practice, ensuring consistency in delivery and team deliverables.
• Lead various initiatives and special projects that require additional collaboration with vendors, clients and/or senior leadership.
• Train and teach the principles of Commercialization to other business units.
• Oversees all communication to stakeholder indicating status and risks to ensure stakeholders are ready to sell, implement and support the solution.
• Oversees the development, coordination, planning and implementation of new processes and procedures to create efficiencies, provide transparency and deliver consistent product methodology.
• Lead project governance processes and ensure stakeholder alignment.
• Develop and manage project timelines, success criteria and maintain project documentation.
• Deliver leadership reporting and communication of project status, issues, risks, milestones, and key decisions made regarding project objectives and direction.
• Facilitate the delivery of services among different product activities to increase effectiveness and efficiency.
• Continuous improvement of the process, driving the development, documentation, and implementation.
• Escalate risks, issues and dependencies and drive to resolution.
• Identify, evaluate, and resolve issues and work cross functionally to problem solve timely.
• Cross functional collaboration, managing and holding team members accountable for delivering tasks on time.
• Ensure commercialization activities operation within policies and procedures of the organization.
• Bachelor’s degree in related field and/or minimum eight years of product/project management and/or Client experience
• Project Management Certification or related training/certification preferred (CX or Lean Six Sigma)

Qualifications:
• Seven (7) plus years project management experience, or equivalent required.
• Certified Project Manager, or equivalent.
• Proven track record of delivering projects on time and managing multiple projects at one time.
• Thorough knowledge of the financial services industry and related products and processes required.

For California, Colorado and New York Applicants: In accordance with the Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the expected salary range for this position is between:
$95,800.00 - $124,500.00

Actual Pay will be adjusted based on experience and other job-related factors permitted by law.

This position qualifies for the following benefits; Co-op Solutions offers a competitive Total Rewards package: 401(k) with generous company match, Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance options, Health Savings Account/Flexible Spending Account, Life Insurance, Short- and Long-Term disability benefits, Pregnancy and Parental Leave, Tuition Reimbursement, Paid Time Off (PTO), Paid Holidays, Community Volunteer Time Off, and an Employee Assistance Program.
